Kitai Raige.Action: Sits frightened and covers ears during air raid, follows sister's instructions to hide under the bed.
Frightened and hesitant during air raid alarm and creature sounds; covers ears and visibly scared.
Follows sister's instructions quickly and hides under the bed without hesitation.
Follows his sister's instructions exactly despite obvious fear, showing trust and obedience.
Eyes fill with water when his sister gives a serious order, showing emotional sincerity and vulnerability.
No explicit hostile or unfriendly behavior; largely silent and compliant in this excerpt.
Follows sister's order promptly and hides in the glass case under the bed, showing obedience and situational awareness.
Appears terrified when sister is attacked, face contorting in terror.
Cries tearfully while clutching his weapon, frozen with fear in front of his sister's attacker.
Touches the holographic figure of his deceased sister sensitively, showing lingering affection and connection.
Does not act to defend or rescue sister in moment of danger, remaining hidden and motionless.
Runs at full speed to keep up despite being smaller and less physically gifted, showing determination and effort.
Runs at full sprint despite being smaller than others, pushes through the crowd to stay near the leader, shows determination to finish first despite physical disadvantages.
Muscles his way to the front despite lack of size and strength.
Ignores caution (Bo's warning) and speeds up prematurely, sprinting ahead of others who are pacing themselves.
Alertly spots a potential threat and calls it out to his team, trying to protect others.
Disregards direct order to fall back into formation while trying to handle the situation himself.
Spots a slight disturbance in the air that others might miss and calls out to the group, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Expertly wields his training staff in battle during the exercise, demonstrating skill and capability.
Is momentarily blinded by a scrim sliding across his vision, though this is caused by an external factor and may affect immediate performance.
Refuses to submit after being pinned down in training; insists on continuing despite setbacks.
Breaks formation causing the whole team to be surrounded and challenged by R.I.'s.
Explains the behavior and danger of the Ursa with clear understanding of its biology and tactics.
Shows an almost beaming smile when discussing his father Cypher's legendary ability to 'Ghost' the Ursa, suggesting admiration and aspiration.
Smiles exhilaratedly after a risky climb, showing enjoyment and a positive attitude.
Refuses to click into harness while climbing, choosing risk over caution.
Engages in competitive but friendly banter with Bo, demonstrating camaraderie.
Free climbing a difficult rock face without a harness, swinging out over a 500-foot drop and successfully pulling himself onto the ridge.
Ignores Bo's warning about the danger and proceeds without safety gear, engaging in a risky maneuver.
Engages in a brief friendly exchange with his mother, shows interest in her work and responds politely.
Speaks with confidence and determination about personal goals (getting into the Ranger Program).
Accurately explains orographic uplifts to his mother, demonstrating technical knowledge.
Eyes blaze with meaning when stating his name during the fear simulation and analysis, implying confidence and focus.
Says he will find out test results tomorrow rather than showing certainty or confidence about outcome.
Calls other cadets who didn't get in 'bums' after not getting into Ranger program on the first try.
Smiles when talking about reading a book and seeking approval from General.
Nods in understanding when told no cake will be made, accepting that being together is enough.
Gets into the Ranger Program on his first try, showing skill and determination.
Reads and tries to memorize parts of a book to impress the General, indicating intelligent preparation and motivation.
Dismisses others who did not get in first try as 'bums,' possibly showing overconfidence or lack of humility.
Sits quietly and attentively, observing the Ranger Academy environment and other cadets, indicating focus and presence.
Pauses and reacts to hearing no one passed the VR test, showing awareness and concern.
Bumps elbows playfully with Bo after agreeing on mutual fear of spiders.
Stands at attention respectfully before Commander Velan and hides his joy at praise.
Is devastated but does not argue or show disrespect when denied advancement by Commander Velan.
Does not move after being dismissed, showing a moment of silent respect or internal processing.
Receives very impressive test scores and is recognized for having a Ranger's mind by Commander Velan.
Fails to advance due to taking unnecessary risks and confusing courage with recklessness.
Remains standing after being dismissed, gathers courage to speak to the commander despite disappointment.
Plead sincerely and vulnerably to Commander Velan to reconsider his assessment, showing dedication and emotional openness.
Stands nearly belligerently after being denied, which could indicate a lack of acceptance or impatience with authority.
Maintains dignity and decorum after rejection, showing self-control and respectfulness.
Pleadings persistently for reconsideration to advance in training despite being denied.
Misreads commander's pause as permission to speak, showing lack of situational awareness.
Maintains discipline and dignity despite emotional distress when denied advancement.
Stands at attention and respectfully reports to his father during military inspection.
Acknowledges corrections from his father without argument or complaint.
Interacts with family silently during an awkward, tense meal, showing no open hostility or coldness.
Stands at attention and reports properly to Cypher Raige during a military inspection.
Has some minor uniform faults pointed out (ragged collar, uneven creases, improperly fastened jacket).
Admits failure to his father and maintains respectful eye contact.
Responds to rejection quietly and does not escalate conflict, despite his mother glaring supportively.
Attempts to leave the table politely after being denied, showing obedience rather than defiance.
Acknowledges his failure to advance to Ranger honestly, maintains eye contact with his father after being corrected.
Mentions his canyon run time being faster than his father’s, demonstrating awareness of his skills and progress.
Attempts to leave the meal in a moment of emotional upset but respectfully asks permission first.
Shows signs of emotional discomfort and reluctance by staring at his plate and being unable to maintain confidence under pressure.
Is shown in a hologram passing the Ranger cadet ceremony and earning an award, demonstrates skill with a cutlass in a drill routine admired by the crowd.
Sits alone in his room, becomes still and silent when his father, Cypher, enters, showing a restrained and possibly conflicted demeanor.
Sits alone quietly in his room, shows disbelief when told to pack and go with Cypher.
Watches the transport ship being fueled and the oversized pod being loaded attentively, showing interest and awareness.
Shakes hands with Lieutenant Alvarez confidently, indicating social competence and readiness.
Merely watches his parents and surroundings without taking active initiative in a tense moment.
Shows eagerness and excitement about traveling with his father, indicating confidence and motivation.
Observes respectfully the reverence given to his father by the Ranger veteran, internalizing the importance of earning respect.
Appears riveted and momentarily startled by Rayna; shows natural social uncertainty.
Very moved, watches as the soldier is led to medical transport, showing empathy.
Attempts to engage in conversation with his father, sharing what he is reading.
Mimics his father in going to sleep but remains wide awake, showing respect but a lack of shared intimacy or communication.
Watches the soldier being helped and is very moved, showing empathy and attentiveness.
Observes the transport ship and the pod with genuine intrigue, indicating curiosity and awareness.
Attempts to engage with his father about reading Moby Dick, showing initiative to communicate but is cut off.
Mimics his father by preparing to sleep but remains wide awake, showing difficulty with self-regulation under stress.
Quietly unbuckles and leaves the sleeping soldiers, showing consideration for not disturbing them.
Hesitates before breaching restricted area, indicating awareness and caution, but ultimately disobeys orders.
Defiantly responds 'Yes, sir' to security chief after being grabbed, showing assertiveness but lacking friendliness or deference.
Quietly unbuckles and moves through the sleeping soldiers without waking them.
Hesitates before breaching the restricted hazardous cargo area, showing awareness of potential danger.
Peeks cautiously into the cargo hold despite it being restricted and potentially dangerous.
Frozen when grabbed and questioned by the security chief, does not immediately respond confidently.
Defiantly answers the security chief’s question with a clear and confident 'Yes, sir.'
Asks questions with curiosity about restricted area despite being challenged, showing openness and sincere interest.
Sticks out chest to look tougher when identity is revealed, showing defensiveness and need to appear strong rather than friendly.
Sticks chest out to look tougher, shows defiance despite being challenged by Security Chief.
Asks questions to understand what's behind the 'Authorized Personnel Only' sign, demonstrating curiosity and some initiative.
Hesitates and gets nervous when approaching the pod, showing lack of confidence or composure in tense situations.
Displays bravado by declaring 'I'm not scared of anything.' in front of peers.
Maintains focus and cautious approach despite peer pressure and teasing.
Steps cautiously closer to the pod despite fear, shows interest and focus.
Claims he is not scared, shows bravado to peers.
Steps defiantly over the line during the tense test, demonstrating focus and courage.
Jumps back startled when the creature reveals itself, showing natural fear response.
Steps defiantly over the line despite clear warnings and tension, trying to Ghost (be fearless) near a dangerous creature.
Fails to control breathing and betrays fear signals involuntarily, causing the creature to react violently.
Immediately follows orders from Cypher without hesitation when instructed to put on a lifesuit and full harness despite concern and lack of information.
Looks nervously into the darkness outside his window while strapped in the transport ship during a tense, dangerous situation.
Grabs his seat with fingers and muscles instantly tensed during violent turbulence.
Sits terrified, nearly hyperventilating during critical ship damage and asteroid storm.
Physically shaking with fear, struggles to breathe but accepts oxygen mask.
Physically shaking with fear when given the oxygen mask and preparing for a dangerous situation.
Instinctively unbuckles his double harness when he sees his dad, showing a reactive but dangerous impulse.
Looks around quickly after hearing the terrifying sound of snapping and splintering, indicating situational awareness.
Tries to stay conscious despite extreme G-forces and physical trauma after ship breaks apart.
Attempts to sit up and free himself from harness while dizzy and in clinical shock.
Removes oxygen mask quickly despite fogging, which causes him to gasp and struggle to breathe.
Silently stares at dead bodies and a trapped corpse's hand, showing horror but also carefully removes the obstruction to allow the airlock doors to close, ensuring safety.
Rushes to lift debris off his injured father, showing concern and urgency.
Focuses on survival actions without expressing verbal comfort or emotional expression toward others in the excerpt.
Recognizes low oxygen level, reacts quickly by putting mask back on and taking a deep breath.
Uses a cutlass tool to remove the dead ranger's arm blocking the airlock doors, allowing them to close and repressurize the cabin.
Freezes momentarily staring at a dead body with horrified eyes showing fear and silence.
Attempts to lift debris from his injured father but is unable to move it and looks around for help or alternatives.
Uses a metal rod to lift debris off his father, relieving him despite the dangerous outcome.
Curls up next to his motionless father and begins to cry, showing emotional vulnerability and care.
Reluctantly rises and self-assesses his physical condition when prompted by his father, showing cooperation but some hesitation.
Uses a metal rod as leverage to lift heavy debris off his father despite initial failure to lift it directly.
Carefully moves the heavy debris to a safer position despite danger in its slamming down.
Shows emotional vulnerability by crying beside his father while waiting for hope.
Performs a self-assessment of physical condition through methodical movement tests and accurately reports 'Good to go'.
Reports to his father on the status of the threat (Ursa contained) though voice shows shakiness.
Follows his father’s orders despite fear and trembling hands, showing determination and trust.
Moves with the pace of a son certain that his father will save the day, indicating reliance on and respect for family.
Reluctantly stands and acts under pressure, showing inner vulnerability but cooperative behavior.
Despite trembling hands and fear, follows detailed emergency instructions to activate exterior motion sensors and locate emergency beacon.
Moves slowly and reluctantly, showing hesitance and lack of confidence at critical moment.
Reluctantly assists his dislocated-shoulder father despite fear and pain, showing determination and care.
Carries the damaged emergency beacon to Cypher promptly after finding it.
Reluctantly but obediently follows Cypher’s instructions to pull on the dislocated shoulder despite his fear and hesitation.
Shows hesitation and fear before pulling on Cypher’s dislocated shoulder.
Carefully lifts his injured father onto the cargo loader despite seeing his father's pain and bleeding, showing concern and care.
Pauses momentarily when noticing his father's physical reaction to touch, showing sensitivity.
Quickly assesses the situation and uses the cargo loader and elevator to get his injured father into the cockpit despite the presence of blood and his father's pain.
Notices the frozen windows but momentarily gets distracted by it before returning to the task at hand.
Pulls dead Navigator into nitro storage container to secure the area despite being shaken.
Approaches his injured father carrying supplies, showing concern though confidence is waning.
Does not respond to his father's request to focus, lost in worry about his father's injuries.
Pulls the dead Navigator into the nitro storage container to secure the area quickly.
Touches the dead bodies and is severely shaken, showing emotional distress.
Approaches his injured father with supplies, though his confidence is waning and he fails to respond when asked to focus on assets.
Focuses on inventory and assists Cypher by retrieving med-kit and Ranger pack despite emotional distress over father's injuries.
Struggles to focus and does not respond to Cypher's initial question, showing emotional preoccupation and possible withdrawal.
Nods with comprehension and accepts the responsibility to retrieve the beacon despite the danger to save his father.
Wipes his eyes quietly, showing emotional vulnerability and connection to his father's plight.
Nods with comprehension when told about the emergency beacon and the need to retrieve it.
Does not falter or waiver despite the dire situation and the emotional weight presented by his father.
Appears unsure when Cypher mentions the tail section location initially, indicating some initial confusion or hesitation.
Takes the inhaler and listens carefully to Cypher's instructions, showing trust and respect.
Allows Cypher to help him with the Navi-band and wears the Ranger backpack as directed, demonstrating cooperation and openness.
Silent and attentive while his father guides and supports him, indicating receptiveness and a strong respectful bond.
Follows Cypher's instructions precisely, takes inhaler correctly, prepares himself with lifesuit and backpack, accepts training equipment seriously.
Remains focused and steady despite emotional difficulty (father passing weapon, possibility of never seeing him again).
Wraps Cypher in a hug despite his small size, showing affection and connection.
Forces himself out of his father's arms and tries to stand tough despite fear, showing restraint and possibly a sense of duty over emotional openness.
Admits he does not know their location when asked.
Listens attentively to his father's briefing about the dangers and protocol.
Hugs his father tightly before departing, showing emotional vulnerability but also connection.
Struggles briefly but then forces himself to stand straight and stay tough while preparing to leave.
Manages a weak military turn and exits to face the unknown.
Communicates promptly and respectfully with his father, follows instructions carefully (e.g., takes a knee when told).
Focuses on survival and environment awareness without expressing fear openly; backs away from danger quietly.
Activates his Navi-band and uses the cutlass with skill, including extending the blade correctly despite a near miss that could have injured him.
Exits the ship into an unknown, dangerous environment, staying alert and armed despite visible signs of danger (dead Rangers), but is frightened and backs away.
Obeys orders promptly, taking a knee when instructed and communicating observations carefully as requested.
Initially has a weak military turn and forced toughness as he leaves his father's arms, showing hesitation and struggle to maintain composure.
Freaks out and slings a tarantula off his hand, momentarily losing balance, then regains control.
Lies to Cypher about slipping to avoid admitting fear or vulnerability.
Calms down and continues the climb despite fear, showing self-control.
Calms himself after receiving information and accurately estimates the distance to the top.
Begins climbing cautiously, placing hands and feet carefully, demonstrating practiced technique.
Freaks out and loses balance when a tarantula lands on his hand, slipping three feet.
Recovers quickly after slipping, stabilizes and regains grip, continuing the climb.
Lies about the cause of his vitals spiking and condition to avoid admitting weakness.
Successfully completes the ascent despite earlier slip and challenging circumstances.
Expresses confidence in his ability to complete the first leg faster than instructed, possibly disregarding a direct order from Cypher.
Attempts to maintain communication by calling out to his father after slowing down and stopping, showing concern for connection.
Questions prescribed time and asserts he can cover 10K in 50 minutes, beginning a light jog confidently.
Disobeys Cypher’s pacing instructions and attempts a faster pace without explicit approval.
Shows concern and panic when unable to reach his father, calls out repeatedly.
Hesitates and is shaken when his father tests his respect and authority recognition.
Snaps to attention and complies with his father's strict order.
Initially panics and calls repeatedly for his father's response in a distressed and fearful manner.
Stops and listens carefully to his father's instructions through the communicator, despite initial panic.
Is shaken and hesitates when questioned by his father but ultimately answers correctly and respects the chain of command.
Snaps to attention and responds promptly with 'Sir, yes, sir!' when his father asserts command strongly.
Acknowledges and promptly follows orders to set his chronometer and proceed to the forest.
Acknowledges and follows Cypher's instructions promptly and clearly without hesitation.
Reaches out to his father over the communicator with a caring 'Hey Dad, you there?'
Communicates clearly and seeks contact with his father in a critical situation through voice over computer.
Acknowledges and follows critical instructions promptly and clearly (e.g., 'Roger,' careful movement along dangerous terrain).
Swallows irritation after being denied a rest and continues hydration and movement as instructed.
Checks his Navi-band and requests breather but corrects himself to say 'Sir', indicating respect and discipline.
Swallows irritation and follows orders to keep moving and hydrate despite wanting a break.
Moves carefully and cautiously through the forest, aware of surroundings.
Stops and becomes steeled when his lifesuit changes color and texture, interpreting it as a possible bad sign.
Breathes erratically but follows commands and stays still when threatened.
Stands motionless and attempts to stay calm despite fear when a potentially dangerous creature approaches rapidly.
Breathes erratically and panics internally though tries to maintain readiness.
Threatens a creature with a rock and shouts aggressively at it despite warnings from Cypher.
Panics and takes defensive violent action when surrounded by creatures, showing instinct for self-protection but no attempt at calm or sympathetic engagement.
Creatures begin mimicking Kitai's moves and picking up weapons after watching him.
Runs and fights creatures aggressively while being chased, showing determination and resilience.
Adapts quickly by using newly crafted batons as weapons and leads creatures to mimic his moves.
Notices the rear threat, spots an opening, and immediately takes off into the forest to evade creatures.
Moves with agility and speed through a dense forest, evading many projectiles thrown by pursuing creatures.
Gets struck in the back but recovers immediately with a fluid forward roll, regaining footing quickly.
Follows Cypher's instructions to cross the river to evade the creatures, showing situational awareness and obedience to guidance.
Looks back to signal to Cypher that creatures are not following, showing connection and trust.
Does not register or trust his father's calm reassurance immediately and continues to flee frantically.
Prepared to fight with cutlass despite no immediate threat, showing wariness but not overt aggression.
Eventually takes a knee and tries to calm himself, showing some self-control and willingness to listen.
Secures his cutlass and dives into the river to evade creatures.
Continues to flee frantically even after confirmation the creatures are no longer following.
Makes a 360-degree turn with cutlass drawn, prepared for threats in all directions.
Fails to immediately trust or respond appropriately to father's calm and clear updates.
Eventually takes a knee, tries to calm himself and regulate breathing after frantic fleeing.
Does not respond immediately, appears shell-shocked and childlike under pressure.
Slowly regains himself and attempts self-assessment despite dizziness and fear.
Initially fails to respond and is shell-shocked, seeming like a child rather than a competent cadet.
Despite dizziness and anxiety, he follows Cypher’s calm instructions to check himself and administer antitoxin.
Follows painful, frightening instructions to inject himself with an antidote despite panic and worsening condition.
Pleads urgently for help from his father, showing vulnerability and trust.

Despite extreme physical distress and worsening symptoms (trembling hands, closing eyes, loss of feeling), Kitai manages to follow complex medical instructions and successfully inject himself with a two-stage antidote, ultimately saving his life.
Fumbles with the needle twice and struggles with the med-kit due to panic and physical deterioration, showing moments of hesitation and uncertainty.
Remains motionless and passive while paralyzed from venom; cannot act due to incapacitation.
Weakly greets his father and communicates despite extreme physical difficulty.
Focuses on mission and does not show overt emotional warmth in interactions with father during crisis.
Slowly opens his eyes and weakly responds to his father after presumed unconsciousness, then awkwardly begins to stand and gather his gear.
Despite weakness and harsh conditions, sets his Navi-band and commits to moving toward the objective while confirming readiness and responding appropriately to commands.
Sprints ruggedly over vicious terrain under deep freeze conditions, showing physical capability and determination.
Encourages himself with playful banter over the computer during a crisis ("Who wasn’t advanced to Ranger? Watch him go.")
Confidently runs while communicating status updates to his father over the computer, showing a sense of awareness and focus under pressure.
Leans into the frame laughing after blowing out candles on the cake remotely, creating a joyful moment for the family.
Reports arrival at the geothermal node promptly and clearly despite harsh environmental conditions, demonstrating focus and responsibility.
Coughs after arriving at the hot spot, indicating some physical struggle but continues to perform duty.
Hides broken breathing fluid vials from father to avoid worry.
Strains not to cough or show weakness to father, stating he doesn't need help.
Hides broken vials of breathing fluid from Cypher and insists he doesn't need it despite struggling to breathe.
Beams with pride when praised by his father, hugs his father safely in his pajamas.
Salutes respectfully and obeys his father's orders to go to bed and give his mother a kiss.
Takes the second vial of breathing fluid reluctantly, face flushed with shame, lies about the remaining amount.
Marches around proudly in father's boots, struggles but persists holding cutlass, beams with pride when praised.
Gives a proper salute, shows respect and discipline by obeying orders to go to bed.
Takes the second vial of breathing fluid reluctantly to meet oxygen needs, showing appropriate response to a critical situation.
Lies about the remaining amount of breathing fluid, pausing before giving a painful lie.
His coughing is brutal and he is clearly in distress, possibly impairing his effectiveness.
Observes carefully the interaction between the bee and spider, showing focused attention and interest in natural phenomenon.
Ducks back into shelter during the storm and endures misery, indicating resilience in a challenging environment.
Expresses awe beyond pity witnessing the bee's fight.
Calls out to his father with concern ('Dad..? Dad --').
Asks father how he overcame his fear, showing openness and desire to learn.
Expresses awe beyond pity witnessing the bee's struggle against the spider, indicating emotional sensitivity but not direct action or problem-solving.
Asks his father directly and earnestly how he managed to beat the Ursa and ghost for the first time, showing initiative to learn and understand strategies from an experienced mentor.
Thinks tenderly of his mother Faia, recalling her pregnancy and beauty during a near-death experience.
Mentally affirms he will survive to meet his son, showing hope and emotional connection.
Respects and absorbs his father's words deeply, reflecting on the interconnectedness of life at the geothermal node.
Despite exhaustion, chooses not to sleep, showing discipline but also a lack of self-care or seeking comfort.
Calmly assesses his situation underwater, notices details like sunlight and his own blood, and maintains mental clarity to survive the attack.
Mentally affirms his will to survive, focusing on the motivation to meet his son, which helps him escape the Ursa.
Despite exhaustion and sleep deprivation, chooses not to sleep in a dangerous environment and maintains alertness.
Moves slow and steady to cover a long, difficult distance, indicating patience and stamina.
Goes back to retrieve the paper wrapper he had thrown on the ground, despite being tired and in a challenging environment.
Keeps going on a difficult trek despite extreme tiredness, carefully retrieves wrapper instead of leaving it behind.
Hesitates briefly before retrieving the wrapper that blows away, showing caution but also minor distraction.
Reacting promptly by ducking and readying his cutlass when the volcano erupts nearby.
Carefully and methodically taps a combination into his cutlass to transform it into climbing picks and uses them to scale a steep hill.
Uses his listening skills to detect a faint sound of water and assesses his environment cautiously before proceeding.
Freezes momentarily to gather information on a suspicious noise instead of rushing forward.
Lies about the amount of breathing fluid to avoid looking incompetent.
Admits to Cypher that he lied because he was scared and thought he would be judged.
Hangs his head and reflects silently after being caught lying and ordered to abort.
Lies about his breathing fluid supplies to superior, hoping to hide a shortage.
Eventually admits to lying and reveals the true state of his supplies after being confronted.
Expresses intense emotional pain and vulnerability openly to his father, revealing his inner turmoil and desire for understanding.
Yells and lashes out emotionally at his father in frustration and despair.
Paces emotionally near the edge of the falls, yells and cries, expressing confusion and distress when confronted with conflicting orders and high stakes.
Shows vulnerability and lack of confidence by questioning his own decisions and needing reassurance from his father after a tactical error.
Confronts the painful truth about his sister's death and questions his father directly despite fear and emotional pain.
Breaks down emotionally and yells in anguish, showing struggle to maintain composure.
Responds to his father's call with a personal oath, insists on his name and identity.
Silence in response to his father's apology and call to return.
Dives off cliff in a risky, solo action to prove himself or fulfill his oath.
Demonstrates courage and determination facing a vicious airborne predator despite serious danger.
Engages in a dangerous solo confrontation without immediate visible support, showing independence but limited indication of warmth towards others in this moment.
Pulls his arms and legs straight to slice through the air like a torpedo, demonstrating a quick, skillful evasive maneuver.
Is struck by the creature's talons and falls awkwardly, possibly unconscious, indicating a failure to maintain control in a dangerous situation.
Allows a newborn baby bird to nuzzle him and slowly takes in his surroundings without showing fear or aggression.
Carefully observes the environment and new creatures around him upon waking, showing awareness and attentiveness.
Initially startled and jumps back from the newborn bird and the surrounding situation.
Reacts rationally by wiping himself clean and taking stock of the surroundings before acting further.
Pushes a newborn creature away with his foot to protect himself.
Moves back and stands in front of the newborn creatures as danger approaches.
Stabs leopard-like creatures attacking newborn condor-like creatures to protect the vulnerable.
Commands 'Leave them alone!' to the attacking creatures, showing concern for others' safety.
Stabs through the branches to attack a leopard-like creature, inflicting pain and forcing it to retreat.
Effectively slices another creature's paw with a spinning cutlass move, showing skillful combat ability.
Rushes forward to skewer a cat-like creature mauling a newborn condor, demonstrating quick and decisive intervention.
Commands others by telling the creatures to 'Leave them alone!,' reflecting confident leadership and situational awareness.
Feels and recognizes the condor-like creature's loss and backs away, slipping into the jungle instead of confronting or harming it.
Clenches his cutlass tightly after the deaths of the newborns but does not act out of aggression or cruelty.
Panics and frantically tries to use his Navi-band when injured and isolated.
Fights off the last beasts and survives a dangerous encounter with the condor-like creature.
Unable to unclench his hands from the cutlass, showing a momentary loss of control or emotional overwhelm.
Recognizes the condor's grief and makes the deliberate decision to back away and slip away, showing situational awareness and restraint.
Checks his Navi-band frantically and panics when he realizes it’s damaged, showing loss of composure under pressure.
Runs urgently through the jungle trying to gain altitude and catch the sun, demonstrating determination and quick reactive thinking.
Steadies himself and gains control after recognizing his reckless anger and grief, showing self-awareness and emotional regulation.
Runs raggedly through the jungle, appearing tired and lost while searching for shelter as the sun sets.
Follows a small vulnerable creature without hesitation, showing curiosity and respect for nature.
Follows an unfamiliar animal cautiously but confidently, using his agility and quickness to navigate difficult terrain.
Without hesitation, enters a hole with expanding icy frost approaching, showing decisiveness and willingness to face danger.
Uses found resources (flat stone) skillfully to dig and gain entry into the hole.
Activates a light on his lifesuit to illuminate the pitch-dark cave, demonstrating preparedness and smart problem solving.
Moves away frightened from the flying snake, watches its actions silently without intervening.
Moves away from the flying snake in fear rather than confronting or assessing calmly.
Finds a good spot near the lava, stays watchful with his cutlass ready despite his fear and shaking.
Tries to settle his mind to stay composed but fails, showing internal struggle with fear and stress.
Draws a detailed map of his journey including personal notes like 'DAD' and 'I AM HERE, I THINK,' showing openness and a connection to family.
Gathers his things quickly to follow the hog family after they seem to acknowledge him with a look, indicating respect and reciprocation to their silent communication.
Clutches his cutlass nervously when a condor circles overhead but continues forward, showing cautiousness and determination rather than aggressive or hostile behavior.
Creates a detailed map of his journey using cave paintings as inspiration, showing situational awareness and planning.
Carefully follows the hog family after they leave the cave, showing tactical decision-making and cautious movement.
Navigates using topographical features he previously sketched, demonstrating skillful use of environmental knowledge.
Clutches cutlass and walks despite obvious fatigue (dark circles under eyes), showing resilience but possible physical limitation.
Holds his cutlass and walks by the depressed condor-like creature calmly, despite its eerie stare.
Urgently tells the condor-like creature 'Leave me alone!' while trying to evade it.
Navigates by a topographical feature he previously sketched, demonstrating situational awareness and use of prior knowledge.
Ducks behind trees and tries to stay hidden from a dangerous creature, showing tactical caution.
Calmly walks past a large and intimidating creature in a state of depression, showing measured confidence.
Hurries in the jungle looking exhausted and weakened, indicating diminishing physical endurance.
Caught in a stampede despite deftly avoiding the first creature, showing some reactive skill but ultimately overwhelmed.
Engages in a silent, mutual moment of connection with the condor creature, mimicking its movements.
Barely makes it to his feet after being trampled and hit multiple times.
Rolls into an opening between colossal trees to break his fall from a high plunge.
Looks around dazed, unsure of what just happened after the fall.
Notices and deliberately mimics the neck movements of a condor creature, showing observational skill and calmness after a traumatic event.
Loses his father's cutlass; it is crushed and broken under the creatures' hooves.
Nods thanks to an unnamed character or creature, showing silent appreciation.
Backpedals slowly and then hurries away without further interaction.
Uses the last vial of breathing fluid for survival without hesitation, showing self-reliance but no visible sharing or connection.
Struggles to survive but continues to work hard by cutting vines and building a raft, demonstrating resilience but not necessarily warmth towards others.
Relaxes and finds calm in nature after intense struggle, showing inner peace but no explicit interpersonal warmth.
Nods thanks and shows growth and changed interaction with environment.
Backpedals slowly into jungle and then hurries on, showing caution followed by decisive movement.
Fumbles with breathing fluid case and nearly passes out from exhaustion.
Uses last vial of breathing fluid despite extreme exhaustion, demonstrating survival awareness.
Takes time to rest but then finds and constructs a makeshift raft from vines and logs.
Successfully navigates the raft down the river while controlling it with a branch.
Holds breath and remains calm as a forty-foot anaconda swims alongside the raft.
Lies down to rest despite potential dangers, risking vulnerability.
Smiles at his big sister Senshi when she gently strokes his face and wakes him up.
Engages in conversation with Senshi, showing openness and connection.
Responds with guardedness by covering his ears and continuing to recite Moby Dick despite Senshi's urgings.
Does not show impatience or anger toward Senshi during her repeated attempts to wake him.
Despite extreme fatigue and near collapse, Kitai struggles to stay mentally engaged by reciting Moby Dick, showing perseverance and mental endurance.
Fails to respond promptly to Senshi's urgent commands to wake up, indicating a momentary lack of responsiveness and alertness when it is critical.
Sprints frantically through the freezing jungle despite the harsh conditions and frost forming on his body and lifessuit.
Collapses to his knees, vision failing, face turning blue, unable to continue moving effectively under extreme cold.
Wakes up from a nightmare, trapped under debris but manages to cover his eyes and crawl out toward the light, demonstrating survival instinct and will to live.
Taps the mother condor gently and thanks her for keeping him warm through the night before realizing she has frozen to death.
Stands silently and solemnly after seeing the frozen mother condor instead of immediately reacting or dismissing her death.
Survives a cold night by using a makeshift nest and relying on natural surroundings.
Realizes the mother condor has frozen to death but remains solemn and moves forward.
Approaches a watering hole peacefully, respects the animals, and drinks water without causing disturbance.
Searches for something in the jungle despite labored breathing, showing determination.
Fails to protect himself from the effects of his breathing fluid wearing off, leading to severe breathing trouble.
Runs forward excitedly upon finding a piece of the ship despite struggling to breathe.
Climbs a strange-looking tree aggressively to get a better view of the environment.
Keeps pushing toward the ship tail despite severe physical distress and coughing.
Places the second beacon in position, enabling a ready alert signal.
Locates the second beacon, places it correctly, and activates it, successfully setting up an alert.
Finds a med-kit in chaotic debris, manages to find and use breathing fluid, even while on the verge of losing consciousness.
Contacts his father urgently to confirm connection and share his progress despite difficult circumstances.
Successfully reaches the tail section of the transport ship and establishes communication despite unclear, shaky signals and difficult conditions.
Persistently attempts to communicate with his father despite the unclear and intermittent connection.
Calls out to his father repeatedly, showing desperate hope and trust in his connection.
Moves cautiously and holds a weapon protectively while investigating the damaged pod, showing care and prudence.
Demonstrates frustration when the beacon fails but does not take it out on others or give up, showing resilience rather than bitterness.
Tries to signal with the beacon despite electrical interference, assesses the environment cautiously holding a cutlass defensively.
Shows doubt and panic when communication with his father falters, becomes desperate.
Rages and destroys the ship’s electronic panel in anger, then stops and takes a knee to pull himself together.
Wipes away tears and tries to think clearly after his outburst.
Listens attentively to his father’s instructions and mentally processes the solution.
Destroys parts of the ship in rage, exhausting himself and showing loss of control before calming down.
Recognizes his frustration, takes a knee on his own to compose himself.
Initially unsure what to do next and wipes away tears, showing momentary confusion and emotional overwhelm.
Listens to Cypher's instructions about the ionic layer and adjusts his plan accordingly, showing ability to think and adapt.
Identifies the black mountain peak and stands up, ready to act based on new understanding.
Keeps running past dead animals and dangerous terrain without hesitation, focusing on survival.
Hesitates momentarily but continues running when encountering dead leopard hanging in trees.
Looks nervous and slows down when encountering hanging hyenas but keeps moving forward.
Ignores Cypher's advice to go left and instead goes right while navigating the lava slopes.
Moves fast and fluidly up the mountain slope, showing physical capability and endurance.
Calls out to his father in fear ('-Dad?') when sensing danger approaching.
Freaks out and brandishes his weapon defensively upon feeling threatened in the ionic cloud.
Kitai bolts up the slope, moving fast and fluidly through the hazardous ionic cloud.
Kitai freaks when he notices his suit changing texture and hears scuttling nearby, showing signs of panic.
Despite fear, Kitai brandishes his weapon and cautiously backs up to the cave entrance, demonstrating some presence of mind.
Kitai calls out 'Dad?' when alone and threatened, indicating uncertainty and emotional vulnerability.
Kitai moves hurriedly into the cave, looking left and right for escape routes despite not knowing where the threat is exactly.
Moves deeper into the cave carefully despite precarious terrain and approaching danger.
Keeps one eye on the exit light while hiding and preparing to defend himself.
Fails to notice the Ursa hanging upside-down above him on the cave ceiling.
Holds his breath and moves stealthily through the cave to evade the Ursa.
Uses the fallen crystal and stalagmites as cover during the Ursa attack, causing the creature to be impaled.
Struggles but attempts to leverage himself free when pinned by the crystal.
Loses his cutlass during the Ursa's attack and becomes trapped with his foot pinned.
Seizes the moment when the Ursa pauses to free himself by scrambling up and squirms out from under the crystal.
Engages in a life-threatening chase with the Ursa, demonstrating resilience and tactical thinking but no direct acts toward others shown in this excerpt.
Chooses a strategic hiding spot among stalagmites, demonstrating awareness of his environment and a thought-out plan for safety.
Maintains silence and stillness while hiding, showing discipline and patience under threat.
Uses his cutlass effectively to ward off the Ursa's claws, actively defending himself in a dangerous situation.
Sometimes takes his eyes off the Ursa’s position momentarily, introducing a momentary lapse in vigilance.
Gets hit by the black globules twice, suffering pain and injury, indicating vulnerability or inability to fully avoid the Ursa's attacks.
Despite being clipped mid-fall and thrown into underground water, Kitai quickly regains composure and continues to swim toward a shaft of light, showing determination and situational awareness.
Turns to look behind him multiple times while swimming in near-total darkness, maintaining awareness of the Ursa’s position and avoiding being surprised.
Allows his suit light to illuminate the water, which attracts eyeless fish that start to tear away his lifesuit.
When the fish scatter due to movement sounds, Kitai uses this moment to swim away from the unexpected direction of the Ursa’s attack, demonstrating adaptability under pressure.
Veers off straight path to use stalactites to propel himself forward and gain space against the Ursa.
Gets disoriented and loses sense of direction during the swim.
Uses training to follow bubbles to identify which way is up and reach the light.
Pulls himself up a vertical rock shaft using foot and hand positioning amid urgency and danger.
Keeps screaming and rising despite being grabbed and cut by the Ursa preventing him from being pulled down.
Screams in anger, pain, and fear but uses all his strength to escape the Ursa and survive.
Uses all his strength and skill to climb up a narrow rock shaft while being attacked by the Ursa, despite pain, anger, and fear.
Successfully escapes the Ursa by reaching the top of the passageway and pulling himself over the edge.
Faces a dangerous environment with ash falling from an eruption and limited options (cliff edge), showing situational awareness though no immediate solution.
Rushes to activate the beacon quickly upon realizing the Ursa is coming and time is short.
Is caught off-guard and physically overwhelmed by the Ursa, suffering severe injuries and losing control of his weapon and beacon.
Lies injured and unsuccessfully tries to reach his cutlass, ultimately letting his arm fall.
Does not panic when Ursa breaks through and approaches; remains calm and composed despite danger.
Watches the ash covering himself and acknowledges the change without distress.
Does not panic when a deadly creature (Ursa) emerges nearby, stays calm and centered.
His fear recedes into perfect center as indicated by his ghost diamond steadying.
Uses environmental factors (ash covering him) to lose scent from the Ursa, demonstrating awareness and tactical thinking.
Calmly positions himself and confronts the Ursa without panic or hesitation.
Silently approaches the Ursa and takes decisive action to defend himself.
Calmly pushes up to one knee despite danger, showing controlled physical response.
Walks right by the Ursa undetected to pick up his cutlass, showing stealth and awareness.
Performs a combination to split his cutlass into two blades, showing technical skill and preparedness.
Begins a fast and agile run, moving like a ghost, demonstrating physical competence.
Executes a parkour leap landing on the Ursa’s back, indicating physical skill and boldness.
Sinks two blades into Ursa’s open wounds, showing combat effectiveness.
Holds on despite being slammed and almost falling multiple times, showing perseverance but also vulnerability.
Demonstrates intense focus and determination to subdue the creature, using skill and persistence without mention of hesitation or cruelty.
Skillfully taps patterns into the cutlass handle to control its weapon modes during combat.
Maintains grip on the cutlass despite being slammed and thrashing on the back of the Ursa.
Successfully guts the creature from the inside using his cutlass, showing tactical precision.
Uses knowledge of the cutlass functionality under extreme stress to slow and subdue a massive alien creature.
Displays confidence by standing atop the dead Ursa and daring it to move.
Stands calmly over the dead Ursa, showing no fear or joy but composed control.
Efficiently disassembles his weapon and retrieves his backpack without hesitation.
Traverses harsh, snowy terrain with agility and strength, appearing unaffected by the conditions.
Successfully operates the transponder beacon to send a powerful distress signal into space.
Emerges confidently in new clothes, moves through the ship decisively, and appears composed despite the tense situation.
Passes by the technician who is awed by his presence, indicating Kitai’s reputation or confidence inspires others.
No indication of hesitation or confusion when entering the medical area where his father lies, showing focus and composure.
Salutes his injured father and gently hugs him, whispering supportively.
